history.content: Just about anything in AI, Machine Learning, and Robotics/Control Theory will involve math and statistics to a large extent.

One must admire the interdisciplinary of those three, as hinted at in my Richard Hamming post earlier. Indeed, I am considering an EECS - Engineering Math and Stats double major.

In particular, what subfields of math and stats are involved in each area?

What is the future potential of each such research area? Important problems in each area?
history.subject: What are some interesting research areas at the intersection/union of math, statistics, and CS?
